pr_title: Bulk CSV export for views-based searches

timeline.message:
Pick correct query for search type

... if a search type is specified for the export.
The assumption that a search may only have a single Query
of course doesn't hold for exports from dashboards, where
a search can have multiple.
Pick the single query containing the requested search type instead.

Fix integration test

...to expect the corrected timestamp format
Fix linter warnings and errors

Make ElasticsearchExportBackend keep all fields

...instead of reducing them down to only the requested ones.
This is important for decorators. A user might want a field in
the result that is added by a decorator based on other fields,
which the user doesn't want to see in the result.

Remove `MessagesRequest#additionalQueryString`

...and concatenate query strings beforehand, if necessary
Change export limit description
Change export setting input labels
Optionally allow creation of custom options when using the Select component
Allow creation of custom fields on CSV export
Update snapshots and fix CSVExportModal text
Remove not needed import
Remove weak Object type definition
Change text style
Always include message field as an initial field in export form
Adjust sort input description
Adjust decorated fields description
Fixing typo
Fix indentation
Disable start download button while export file is being generated
Revert not needed propTypes placement change
Fix FetchProvider behaviour on unauthorized requests
Close CSVExportModal after finished download
Import * as React when importing react instead of only default
Integrate view type specific export start in export strategy
Refactor Select component structure
Refactor export filename creation

Extract building MessagesRequest to own class

Introduced CommandFactory to improve the code for building a MessagesRequest from a Search and MessageList (if available).

Only support ElasticsearchQueryString in export

We don't have anything else anyway, and this avoids type casting

Introduce ExportMessagesCommand

Having a separate class makes it simpler to distinguish what the api accepts from what we need for processing an export.
Most prominently we want to convert all time ranges to absolute before processing so that we can submit the absolute time range to the audit log exactly as it's executed

Add decorators to ExportMessagesCommand

Finding the decorators to apply belongs in CommandFactory. This will also make it simpler to add in support from decorators that are not directly attached to message lists.
E.g., decorators configured for streams, if we want to use them, or decorators a user might want to specify on API requests.

Add decorators to ExportMessagesCommand

Finding the decorators to apply belongs in CommandFactory. This will also make it simpler to add in support from decorators that are not directly attached to message lists.
E.g., decorators configured for streams, if we want to use them, or decorators a user might want to specify on API requests.
Disable sort direction select if no sort is selected
Only allow export messages limits greater than one
Create MessagesExportUtil for API calls on CSV export
Remove font-awesome from package.json
Use search specific endpoint to export all messages of a search

timeline.bodyText: This could be replaced by using the LinkedHashSetUtil#linkedHashSetOf() method. I think I saw a few more places where you could use the newly introduced util class.
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: How about using Message.FIELD_GL2_MESSAGE_ID here instead of hardcoding the field name here?
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: Is this a typo or intentional? runAsyncc with a double c
timeline.author: bernd

replies.bodyText:
HOW DARE YOU DOUBT MY SPELLING!
will fix...
replies.author: alex-konn

timeline.bodyText: How about trimming the queryString() here to handle typos like " *" and similar?
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: This class seems to be unused.
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.bodyText: The leading wildcard handling probably needs to be enabled.
timeline.author: bernd

timeline.message: Provide search execution state on CSV export

Fix integration test

...to expect the corrected timestamp format
Fix FetchProvider behaviour on unauthorized requests
Fix FetchProvider behaviour on unauthorized requests
Extend CSV export modal
Disable widget csv export for every widget which is not a message list
Cleanup code
Add csv export button for dashboard actions menu and use view instead of view store in CSVExportModal
Further code refactoring
Creat separate component for sortable field select
Simplify widget and title extraction

Add separate API endpoints for new views export
- Added MessagesResource
- Added generic endpoint for search-type-independent results
- Added search-type-specific endpoint. Tbd, if this is actually
  needed for the first iteration. Will be thrown out, if not
- Stubbed resulting CSV for now
Split up modal steps and create separate components
Enable audit events for MessagesResource
Removed wrong import
Improve description
Refactor code style
Add info about sort seelction
Unify naming
Create MessagesExportUtil for API calls on CSV export
Use correct payload when exporting csv
Implement correct url creation for message export
Implement downloadjs and extend FetchProvider for file downloads
Show info when no message list is existst on a dashboard
Improve CSVExportModal code quality by implementing export strategies
Rename fixedWidgetId prop to directExportWidgetId
Add tests
Sort imports

Add tests for csv export download execution
- Add mock for fetchFile in FetchProvider
- Fix search type flow type definition by using string instead of String
- Use lodash flatten instead of Array.prototype.flat() due to missing jest / jsdom support
Disable download when no fields got selected
Clean up CSVExportModal component by splitting the related logic
Add flow-types stub for downloadjs
Fix flow errors
Add flow annotation for downloadjs stub
Fix linter warnings
Fix typo

WIP: add dedicated ElasticsearchExportBackend

- Added separate class for making the "search after" request
  It doesn't actually use "search after" yet. Will be added next.
  It might turn out to be better to integrate this with the big
  ElasticsearchBackend of the views context, but I don't want to do
  that from the start, because that would make getting started much
  more difficult and I'm not sure that that's even a good idea.
- Added default values for MessagesRequest
- Added validation for completeness of MessagesRequest
Continued implementing ElasticsearchExportBackend

Use LinkedHashSet in MessagesRequest

... to guarantee ordering of fields and sort
JsonIgnore convenience getter on ElasticsearchQueryString

Run "search after" queries asynchronously

- Use Executor in MessagesResource
- Forward chunks to ChunkedOutput via callbacks

Add named ThreadFactoryBuilder

...to properly name the resulting thread.

Allow mocking async execution in MessagesResource

to avoid flaky tests
Fix merge conflict in package.json
Remove font-awesome from package.json
Some cleanup in ElasticsearchExportBackend
Build MessagesRequest for export from Search
Use additional query string in ElasticsearchExportBackend
Require streams and fieldsInOrder to be specified

Copy permission checks from SearchResource to MessagesResource

While copying that code is certainly not ideal, I decided to hold off
on implementing a better solution until we have a better way to check
permissions in general. Better to stick to one awkward way of doing things
than inventing another slightly-better-but-not-really-good variant that's only
used in one place.
Add default streams also for plain messages request
Remove not needed CSVExportModal component, which is a leftover from the lest rebase
Added endpoint with only search id
Added missing license header
Fix failing test
Introduce SimpleMessage class instead of using plain strings
Introduce collection class SimpleMessages

Write response chunks as csv

- Added a SimpleMessageChunkCsvWriter, which is a JAX-RS MessageBodyWriter,
  similar to ScrollChunkWriter for the old export
- Renamed SimpleMessages to SimpleMessageChunk

Add charset to string construction in test

...to satisfy forbiddenapis check

Minor cleanup

- Deleted unnecessary file
- Filled in error message for Jest call in ElasticsearchExportBackend

Extracted async run and creation of ChunkedOutput

...to new class ChunkedRunner. This simplifies MessagesResource,
adds a central place for error handling, and removes the necessity
to close the output via an onDone callback passed down to
ElasticsearchExportBackend
Allow overriding default chunk size from request
Added integration test
Remove yarn-error.log
Fix yarn.lock conflict
Use search specific endpoint to export all messages of a search

Add basic decorators support for export

- Added interface ChunkDecorator, which is used by MessagesExporter to apply decorators
- Added implementation LegacyChunkDecorator to encapsulate the current decorators logic.

Add basic decorators support for export

- Added interface ChunkDecorator, which is used by MessagesExporter to apply decorators
- Added implementation LegacyChunkDecorator to encapsulate the current decorators logic.
- Extracted LegacyDecoratorProcessor from ESMessageList for reuse

Add index and _id to SimpleMessage for legacy decorator support

The old decorators implementation relies on an _id field and the the index name to map decorated messages to the undecorated original

Set additional fields on SearchResponse

Make a best effort to set the non-message fields on SearchResponse. This is not necessary for our own decorators, but users might use their own, which rely on these fields.
Show loading spinner after starting CSV export
Improve loading indicator code style
Show loading spinner after starting CSV export
Add method for view to get search type by widget id
Change sort input description
Remove _id field for asserts in ElasticsearchExportBackendIT

Simplified setting defaults on MessagesRequest

Removed custom validation for now and will add it back where it makes sense.

Add @NotEmpty validation where it makes sense for

- MessagesRequest#fieldsInOrder (default will be applied if null)
- MessagesRequest#sort (default will be applied if null)
- ResultFormat#fieldsInOrder (default will be applied if null)

Respect allow_leading_wildcard_searches config

- Injected config value in ElasticsearchExportBackend
- Extracted shard error parsing from ElasticsearchBackend
  to JestUtils for reuse
- Added JestWrapper instead of using JestUtils in
  ElasticsearchExportBackend to avoid static method calls
  in tests, which complicate mocking
Small cleanup

Add parameter support

- Added wrapper class QueryStringDecorator for use in MessagesExporter
- Parameters are resolved using a stubbed `SearchJob`. The map of QueryResults for use only in QueryReferenceParameters is left empty, because we decided to get rid of QueryReferenceParameters completely. Thank goodness. That would have been an even bigger mess.
- The ResultFormat API parameter can now also contain an execution state, equivalent to what's used for search execution. That's where parameter values come in. (It's also used to parse global overrides from dashboards - something we had overlooked so far).
Add missing license header

Fix failing tests

...by correctly mocking QueryStringDecorator in MessagesExporterTest
Add limit parameter
Fix sloppy method name in ChunkedRunner
Trim string in ElasticsearchQueryString.isEmpty
Use `LinkedHashSetUtil::linkedHashSetOf` in more places
Reuse constant Message.FIELD_GL2_MESSAGE_ID
Add limit input for CSV export modal
Provide search execution state on CSV export
Adjust limit description
Refactor CSVExport modal test structure
Test if search execution state is being provided on export
Use selected widget or view title as filename
